page.title: 03Ingon Manor Farm S.on A.
page.content: Mixed Farming takes place at Ingon Manor Farm.There are 150 acres,32 of which are used for pasture,the rest as arable land.There are 100 Texel Cross sheep,200 lambs,2 cows,3 Charolais Cross calves,15 stall bullocks,2 horses,4 peacocks,3 peahens,12 hens, 1 cock,and 3 dogs.The sheep in lamb are fed with barley.The cattle eat hay and silage in the winter and graze in the summer.Barley,oats,and grass are grown for the livestock and spring wheat is sown for sale.The farmer and one man work the farm.The average day starts at 7am and finishes at 7pm depending upon the season.The farm has a wide range of machinery including 5 tractors,a combine harvester,a baler, and a plough.The c.1750 barn is of brick with a beamed roof.On one of the ridge tiles of the farm house is the date 1667.Conservation is to the fore.
